chunks.original_text: 太上三十六部尊经上清境经下 炼生经．灵秘经．消魔经．无量经．按魔经．上通经　已上六经同卷 上清境灵秘经　第八 夫人居天地之间，开辟以来，自有名字为人。 人乃中和之气，凡物之长也。 尊且贵，与天地相似。 而不能与天地长久，是招摄之道不能修习，所以致其沦丧。 至人能明是理，会合形神，修真炼气，造於俱妙之地，自可逍遥正性，直入金门，永断轮回，超升成道，誓度众生，作诸善缘。 当知人身难得，真道多迷。 若失人身，万劫难复。 今或一死，乃终古穷天毕地，莫知其因； 既死之后，莫知其往。 乃是摄魂集魄，会合其身，顷刻之间，复归杳冥，故大可悲哀，大可痛伤。 我今语子，当明正见，了悟生死，不为悲叹，一切冤尤，俱得解脱，永不为累。 故天地格法，天地万物父母，恐於其中复有自冤自哭，致诸苦恼，妄生恶业，实非天地患难所钟。 苦毒难忍，仰呼於天，俯叩於地，而自悲伤，称其冤苦。 故天地为生真道，一切奇方转转教人，炼魂陶魄而能生化，然后可以自防而得小寿。 初无正道大智慧法，通解要法，与天地齐其长久，与日月齐其明照，与星辰随其周运，与劫数随其轮转，虽得小寿，亦无利益。 凡有形赋受於天地之间，皆有磨灭。 况於人居天地之间，七情六欲有以牵缠，富贵得以骄忽，自谓充足，不知思慕真道，贫贱自生怨恨，反道轻身，不生惭愧，惟生恶业。 学道之人初乘智慧，未达世机，尚萦烦恼而有所求，亦不肯力学真道善方，自生轻忽而共生悔恨，笑贱真道，反以为邪伪，但求小利以乱天道，欺罔正真，自致死地。 一切愚人皆知有死，修治坟冢，皆欲坚固不坏，预修作死约，制造凶服以遗子孙用，多置财宝以为威仪具备，世俗可观，种种如法，实无利益。 不思此身既死，若复更生，作何报对。 汝等若非听受吾言，亦应如是。 我於一切法中皆明正道，示诸众生，随缘应感，不复贪着，快乐自在。 而说偈曰： 发一切心，皆当尽意。 若男若女，须明妙本。 即於此时，念念不退。 是我弟子，有道之人。 常行上行，不处四恶。 不行邪欲，不行一切。 种种诸业，不见所有。 不见所无，念道求法。 灵秘经灵符 上清境灵秘经　终 太上三十六部尊经上清境经下 炼生经．灵秘经．消魔经．无量经．按魔经．上通经　已上六经同卷 上清境消魔经　第九 人之生世，常知有归，生死周回，曾不休息。 譬如日出於东，亦自西沉。 古今帝王圣贤，亦皆如是。 但於时时每思自重，爱生畏死，旦夕思念，皆求异闻，妄假殊方异术，以为延生，反害其性。 敬事鬼神，谄求余福，将以求福，反以招祸。 应有道术之士托为祥瑞，自谓感动天地，得延老寿，可以度世。 萌此念愿，即生妄想，信邪败正，自沉恶趣，永不解悟，不修正道，不明正因，不遇善知识，不断恶根本，不能深计远虑，自致忧恼，昏乱不明。 如此之事，皆为反道害教，造无边罪。 不复忏悔，是其邪说已固，正道难入，故能如是。 古者圣人聪明大达，以为天下万世规模，亦欲后世皆知邪道而能魔障善道，故明智慧； 亦令一切魔鬼皆悉消除，俱闻正道。 而於利益，不可思议。 当时亦出众贤，人俱会盛时讲明法要，实为辅相，洞明天地始终，深穷往复输回，不言人死复生之理，不言生死异途，亦不明言生死去来不实，言无生灭法要，使得道者自达玄机，了生灭法，而於智慧无有限量，生灭之理自然无畏，一切种智普及后来。
chunks.translated_text:
**The Supreme Thirty-Six Revered Scriptures of the Upper Clarity Realm, Lower Scroll: The Scripture of Refining Life, The Scripture of Numinous Secrets, The Scripture of Dispelling Demons, The Immeasurable Scripture, The Scripture of Subduing Demons, The Scripture of Upper Communication** *(The above six scriptures share a single scroll)*

**The Scripture of Numinous Secrets of the Upper Clarity Realm, Chapter Eight**

Man dwells between Heaven and Earth. Since the opening of creation, he has borne the name of "human." Humanity is the *qi* of central harmony, the foremost of all beings. Noble and revered, he resembles Heaven and Earth. Yet he cannot endure as long as Heaven and Earth, for he fails to cultivate the Dao of gathering and refining, thus bringing about his own ruin.

The perfected person, understanding this principle, unites form and spirit, refines truth, and cultivates *qi*, attaining the realm of perfect subtlety. There, he may roam freely in his true nature, enter the Golden Gate, forever sever the cycle of rebirth, transcend and attain the Dao, vow to deliver all beings, and create boundless good causes.

Know this: the human body is hard to obtain, yet the true Dao is often obscured. If one loses this human form, it is difficult to regain even after ten thousand kalpas. Now, with a single death, one may wander endlessly through heaven and earth, never knowing the cause. After death, none know their destination. The soul is gathered, the spirit assembled, the body reunited—yet in an instant, all returns to darkness. How grievous! How lamentable!

I now tell you: awaken to right view, comprehend life and death, and cease all sorrow. All karmic grievances shall be dissolved, never to burden you again.

Thus, the laws of Heaven and Earth decree that they, the parents of all things, fear that within their midst, beings may bring suffering upon themselves, weeping in vain, giving rise to afflictions and false evil karma—truly, not by Heaven and Earth’s calamity are these woes bestowed. The bitterness is unbearable; they cry out to Heaven above and knock upon the Earth below, mourning their own sorrow, proclaiming their grievances.

Therefore, Heaven and Earth generate the true Dao, endlessly teaching all wondrous methods to refine the soul and forge the spirit, enabling transformation and self-preservation to attain a modest longevity. Yet there is no great wisdom of the true Dao, no essential method to comprehend and align with Heaven and Earth’s eternity, to match the sun and moon’s radiance, to follow the stars’ revolutions, or to turn with the kalpas’ cycles. Though one may gain a modest lifespan, it brings no true benefit.

All beings endowed with form between Heaven and Earth are subject to decay. How much more so for man, entangled by the seven emotions and six desires, ensnared by wealth and arrogance, self-satisfied and unaware of yearning for the true Dao; or by poverty and lowliness, breeding resentment, scorning the Dao, and feeling no shame, only generating evil karma.

Those who study the Dao, though initially guided by wisdom, may not yet grasp worldly mechanisms. Still bound by afflictions and desires, they refuse to diligently learn the true Dao and its virtuous methods, growing careless and remorseful, mocking the true Dao as false, seeking petty gains to disrupt the heavenly order, deceiving the upright and true, and thus hastening their own demise.

All foolish people know they will die, yet they prepare tombs, seeking permanence, arranging funerary pacts, crafting mourning garments for descendants, amassing treasures to display grandeur—all according to worldly custom, yet utterly without benefit. They do not consider: when this body dies and is reborn, what karmic retribution will follow? If you do not heed my words, you too shall act thus.

In all Dharma, I clarify the true Dao, revealing it to all beings. Responding to conditions and resonances, I am free from attachment, joyful and at ease.

And so a gāthā says:
With all your heart, give your utmost intent.
Whether man or woman, you must fathom the wondrous origin.
At this very moment, let each thought be unwavering.
Such are my disciples, those of the Dao.
Ever practice the highest conduct, never dwelling in the four evils.
Do not indulge in depraved desires, nor any misdeeds.
See not what exists, nor what does not.
Focus your mind on the Dao, seek the Dharma.

**Numinous Talisman of the Scripture of Numinous Secrets**
**End of the Scripture of Numinous Secrets of the Upper Clarity Realm**

**The Supreme Thirty-Six Revered Scriptures of the Upper Clarity Realm, Lower Scroll: The Scripture of Refining Life, The Scripture of Numinous Secrets, The Scripture of Dispelling Demons, The Immeasurable Scripture, The Scripture of Subduing Demons, The Scripture of Upper Communication** *(The above six scriptures share a single scroll)*

**The Scripture of Dispelling Demons of the Upper Clarity Realm, Chapter Nine**

Man’s life in the world should always know its return. The cycle of life and death turns without cease, like the sun rising in the east and setting in the west. Even the ancient sage-kings and worthies were no different.

Yet in every era, one should reflect deeply, cherishing life and fearing death, constantly seeking rare knowledge, vainly relying on strange methods and arts to prolong life—only to harm one’s nature. Revering spirits and ghosts, flattering for blessings, they seek fortune but invite misfortune.

Those who claim to possess the Dao’s arts, feigning auspicious omens, boast of moving Heaven and Earth, gaining longevity, and transcending the world. Once such desires arise, delusion follows. Trusting the false, they corrupt the true, sinking into evil destinies, never awakening. They do not cultivate the true Dao, nor understand its causes, nor meet good teachers, nor sever the roots of evil. Unable to plan wisely for the future, they bring upon themselves sorrow and confusion.

Such actions reverse the Dao and harm the teachings, creating boundless sin. Without repentance, their false doctrines solidify, and the true Dao cannot enter—thus they persist in error.

The sages of old, wise and far-seeing, established models for all under Heaven and future generations. They wished for posterity to recognize false paths and demonic obstructions of the good Dao, thus illuminating wisdom. They also sought to dispel all demonic spirits, that all might hear the true Dao. The benefits are beyond conception.

In those times, many worthies gathered in flourishing assemblies to expound the essential Dharma, serving as guides. They thoroughly understood the beginning and end of Heaven and Earth, deeply explored the cycles of return, yet did not speak of life after death, nor of life and death as separate paths. They did not explicitly state that life, death, coming, and going are illusory, but taught the essential Dharma of non-arising and non-ceasing. Thus, those who attained the Dao could themselves grasp the profound mechanism, comprehend the Dharma of life and death, and their wisdom became boundless. The principle of life and death naturally held no fear, and the wisdom of all things spread to future generations.

chunks.original_text: 如闻是法，亦皆得度无上至真要路，登大法桥，直超道岸。 若复有人尊重正教，具足智慧，亦复如是，永除贪着，魔王保举，上达帝庭。 上及帝王，得之则垂拱无为，天下自治。 贤者得之，尽其孝悌忠信，上辅其君，安镇国祚，灾害不生，妖孽永消，吉星常照，祸星自灭，兵戈不起，春瘟不行，夏疫不作，秋疠不兴，冬广不侵，风调雨顺，禾稼丰登。 一国男女欣乐太平，广大徧满，无有穷尽。 更能精心奉持，永灭三涂五苦八难，执符把籍，直上玉京，逍遥自在； 升入朱宫，炼度身形，名标紫策，受命丹霄。 五帝大魔、诸天上仙、三界魔王、飞天神王、无量大神并乘恩宥，咸度妙法，徧游诸天，共保具举，飞升上清。 而说偈曰： 心发大愿，作是福力。 今及大众，亦当信念。 自得高妙，真正妙法，得无量善，上道徧知。 正念弘普，令来众生，行时当得，长本入妙， 智慧具足。 有相无相，最大智慧，离诸他念。 消魔经灵符 上清境消魔经　终 太上三十六部尊经上清境经下 炼生经．灵秘经．消魔经．无量经．按魔经．上通经　已上六经同卷 上清境无量经　第十 天地正统，永除灾难。 日月五星，光明晃曜。 兆民因而兴盛，各发善念。 迨夫人民嚣浮，时俗态异，自伤和气，天地兴夫大怒，日月星辰三光失明，天地战斗不和。 其验则风雷不时，伤损物性，各不发生； 兆民死伤，阴阳气战斗不和，五谷不熟，水火失度，灾难并起。 夫阴与阳本合，相扶助共生和气，而反战斗。 我故明示法要，讲说禳谢之因，得免诸难，俾令一切人民皆知道本。 於是至真大神、无鞅数众、一切天真、十方无极无量品圣众咸皆稽首，上白天尊曰：臣等未知正道探妙。 幸望大慈广为宣说。 敢问亢旱、一切草木焦枯、民困饥饿而死，是何异因？ 天尊曰：夫亢旱之灾，乃是太阳失度，六阳俱恨，因以为害也。 阳九之数一千八百年，遇甲为太阳九； 百六之数一千六百年，遇申为大百六。 阳九不过甲，百六不遇申，不为灾矣。 小阳九一百八十年，小百六一百六十年，总运甲申，方为灾矣。 若不甲申，不为灾矣。 敢问水灾？ 天尊曰：水是太阴失度，六阴俱恨，因为害也。 皆同其数。 敢问火灾？ 天尊曰：火是火星躔度，失次过所，过分野，下为童谣，美则为福，恶则为凶。 下寅、申、巳、亥位，主焚州县津镇。 下子、午、卯、酉位，主焚寺院、宫宇、庙舍。 下辰、戌、丑、未位，主焚人民住居、城市、山泽舟船。 於是大众咸为启请：若有此厄，如何救度？ 天尊遂谓众曰：夫水早火灾，皆因人民为善与不为善。 乡境为善，灾变为福； 乡境为不善，福变为灾。 复有天搀、天抢二星下降，主盗贼纷乱，劫夺人物，杀害性命。 若不修崇醮筵，拜奏表文，应难禳度。 於是天尊乃示太乙醮式，令宝德真人下降流传，令一切人民俱免灾难，永无水火旱魃、盗贼灾殃。 如是利益，广及一切。 若於所在，无力修崇，可以斋戒沐浴，请命道士专诵此经，乃至百徧，亦可禳度。 而说偈曰： 道法无名，在人修行。 至真妙法，难得遭遇。 汝今得遇，夙生庆幸。 转转教人，作大福力。 灾殃自解，福庆旋臻。 若能敬奉，常亨利贞。 天地阴阳，皆调和气。 一切人民，皆得自在。
chunks.translated_text:
Upon hearing this Dharma, all may cross to the supreme, most true essential path, ascend the great Dharma bridge, and directly transcend to the Dao’s shore. Should there be those who revere the true teaching and possess perfect wisdom, they too shall likewise forever cast aside greed and attachment, with demon kings as their guarantors, ascending to the imperial court. Should emperors and kings attain this, they may govern with effortless virtue, and the realm shall govern itself. Should the worthy attain this, they shall fulfill filial piety, fraternal duty, loyalty, and trust, aiding their sovereign above, stabilizing the nation’s destiny. Disasters shall not arise, malevolent omens shall forever vanish, auspicious stars shall ever shine, inauspicious stars shall self-destruct, weapons shall not be raised, spring pestilence shall not spread, summer epidemics shall not arise, autumn plagues shall not stir, winter epidemics shall not invade. Wind and rain shall be harmonious, crops shall flourish abundantly. Throughout the land, men and women shall rejoice in great peace, its vastness filling all without end. Should one further devote oneself to upholding it with utmost sincerity, the three paths, five sufferings, and eight adversities shall be forever extinguished. Grasping the talisman and holding the register, one shall ascend directly to the Jade Capital, carefree and at ease; ascending into the Vermilion Palace, refining and transcending the bodily form, one’s name shall be inscribed on the Purple Register, receiving the mandate of the Crimson Empyrean.

The Five Emperors, great demons, all celestial immortals, demon kings of the Three Realms, flying heavenly deities, and boundless great spirits shall together receive grace and pardon, all attaining the wondrous Dharma. They shall traverse the heavens, jointly safeguarding and elevating, ascending to the Supreme Clarity.

Then a gāthā was spoken:
With the heart’s great vow, this merit’s power,
Now extending to the great assembly, all should believe and hold fast.
Attaining the lofty and wondrous, true and subtle Dharma,
Gaining boundless goodness, the Dao’s wisdom pervades all.
With right mindfulness widely propagated,
For future beings who practice in due time,
They shall attain the eternal root and enter the wondrous,
Their wisdom complete.
Whether with form or without,
The greatest wisdom,
Free from all other thoughts.

*The Scripture of Supreme Clarity on Dispelling Demons* concludes here.
*The Thirty-Six Revered Scriptures of the Most High: The Lower Scripture of Supreme Clarity*
*The Scripture of Refining Life, The Scripture of Numinous Secrets, The Scripture of Dispelling Demons, The Immeasurable Scripture, The Scripture of Subduing Demons, The Scripture of Ascending Communication*—the above six scriptures are in one scroll.
*The Immeasurable Scripture of Supreme Clarity*, Scroll Ten

The orthodoxy of Heaven and Earth shall forever dispel calamities. The sun, moon, and five planets shall radiate brilliant light. The people shall thereby flourish, each awakening to virtuous thoughts. Yet when the people grow restless and the customs of the age shift, harming the harmonious qi, Heaven and Earth shall greatly rage, the three luminaries of the sun, moon, and stars shall lose their brightness, and Heaven and Earth shall contend, no longer in harmony. The signs shall be untimely winds and thunder, harming the nature of things so that none may grow; the people shall perish and be injured. Yin and yang shall contend, no longer in harmony, the five grains shall not ripen, water and fire shall lose their measure, and disasters shall arise together. For yin and yang were originally united, mutually aiding to generate harmonious qi, yet now contend instead.

Thus, I clearly reveal the essential Dharma, expounding the causes of expiatory rites, that all may be spared from calamities and all people come to know the root of the Dao. Thereupon, the perfected great spirits, innumerable hosts, all celestial perfected ones, and the boundless, immeasurable assemblies of sages from the ten directions all bowed their heads and addressed the Heavenly Worthy, saying: “We have yet to fathom the subtleties of the true Dao. We humbly beseech your great compassion to broadly proclaim it. We dare ask: when there is severe drought, all grasses and trees wither, and the people suffer and die of hunger, what is the extraordinary cause?”

The Heavenly Worthy said: “The disaster of severe drought arises from the sun losing its measure, the six yang forces all resentful, thereby causing harm. The yang nine cycle spans one thousand eight hundred years, and when it encounters *jiǎ*, it is the great yang nine. The hundred six cycle spans one thousand six hundred years, and when it encounters *shēn*, it is the great hundred six. If the yang nine does not meet *jiǎ*, or the hundred six does not meet *shēn*, it shall not be a disaster. The lesser yang nine spans one hundred eighty years, the lesser hundred six one hundred sixty years; only when their cycles converge on *jiǎ* and *shēn* shall it be a disaster. If not *jiǎ* and *shēn*, it shall not be a disaster.”

“We dare ask about floods?”
The Heavenly Worthy said: “Floods arise from the moon losing its measure, the six yin forces all resentful, thereby causing harm. The cycles are the same.”

“We dare ask about fires?”
The Heavenly Worthy said: “Fires arise from the fire star deviating from its path, transgressing its proper position and passing through regions beyond its domain. Below, it manifests as children’s rhymes: if auspicious, it brings fortune; if inauspicious, it brings misfortune. When it descends in the *yín*, *shēn*, *sì*, and *hài* positions, it shall burn prefectures, counties, ferries, and towns. When it descends in the *zǐ*, *wǔ*, *mǎo*, and *yǒu* positions, it shall burn temples, palaces, ancestral halls, and dwellings. When it descends in the *chén*, *xū*, *chǒu*, and *wèi* positions, it shall burn the people’s homes, cities, mountains, marshes, and boats.”

Thereupon, the assembly all entreated: “If such calamities occur, how may they be saved?”
The Heavenly Worthy then addressed the assembly, saying: “Floods, droughts, and fires all arise from whether the people practice goodness or not. If a village practices goodness, disasters shall turn to fortune; if a village does not practice goodness, fortune shall turn to disaster. Furthermore, the two stars of Heavenly Usurpation and Heavenly Plunder descend, bringing bandits and chaos, plundering possessions and taking lives. If one does not perform grand jiao rites and submit memorials in worship, the calamities shall not be averted.”

Thereupon, the Heavenly Worthy revealed the rites of the Great Unity jiao, commanding the Treasure Virtue Perfected One to descend and transmit them, that all people might be spared from calamities, forever free from floods, fires, drought demons, bandits, and disasters. Such benefits shall extend broadly to all. If in a given place one lacks the means to perform the rites, one may fast, bathe, and purify oneself, then invite a Daoist to recite this scripture exclusively, even a hundred times, and the calamities may still be averted.

Then a gāthā was spoken:
The Dao’s methods are nameless,
Dependent on human cultivation.
The most true and wondrous Dharma,
Rare to encounter.
You now encounter it,
A blessing from past lives.
Teach others in turn,
Creating great merit’s power.
Disasters shall dissolve,
Fortune shall swiftly arrive.
If one can revere and uphold it,
Ever shall there be harmony and prosperity.
Heaven and Earth, yin and yang,
All shall harmonize their qi.
All people
Shall attain freedom and ease.

chunks.original_text: 无量经灵符 上清境无量经　终 太上三十六部尊经上清境经下 炼生经．灵秘经．消魔经．无量经．按魔经．上通经　已上六经同卷 上清境按魔经　第十一 天地分形之后，判以清浊，清者为天，浊者为地。 以何为始？ 始十极千，位证真人，分形教化，而后天地阴阳日月运行之度始分。 度数得定，於是分炁。 东方九炁，木位柔顺； 南方三炁，火炁猛焰。 火炁惟三，与木位九炁相等平分一十二炁。 西方七炁，金位坚实； 北方五炁，水炁浩荡。 水惟之炁，与金位七炁相等平分一十二炁。 东北、东南、西南、西北取四方余炁为梵炁。 东南炁平，西北炁平，与四方炁同。 东北炁多生山石、大木、巨兽，西南炁少，惟生宝物。 上、下二位，即中央土位分一十二炁。 起为天，藏为地，故天地各有三十六炁，而后能生产万物。 於是十极至真大神、天真大圣同时稽首，上白天尊曰：臣等幸闻正教，未达玄机。 惟愿慈悲广为宣说。 天尊谓大众曰：天地之炁随数运动，亦有否终。 日月五星诸天星宿至圣神人难免灾否，而况末学道浅，欲无疾伤。 於是大众咸皆惊怖，稽首再拜：若有此灾，如何救度？ 天尊曰：汝等宿生庆幸，得遇善因、种种见闻。 夫人之生於天地间，皆为七情六欲迷乱身心，遂使不闻正道，不悟妙法，惟罪是修，故虽忏悔。 我今为汝宣扬正教，敷演玉音，看转真经，广陈供养。 或因甲子，或遇庚申，或於正月，或於七月，或於十月，并八节、本命、生辰，严持香火，精勤奉法，修集至真之炁，会合阴阳，通上下血脉，与天地交，纳正炁，却除邪秽，灾病不生，鬼魅悉除，五路通达，六畜兴生。 汝宜听受，转转教人，悉令后学俱闻善果，皆获吉利，阖门眷属悉沾胜善。 是经乃名为不可思议，其功德力亦不可思议。 於是诸天仙众、无量天真、至真大圣、无量无边诸天大神、无鞅数众俱闻是语，皆生欢喜，拥护教法，流传於世，普令一切利益无量，勿令下世未悟凡夫轻泄漏慢，不获福果。 而说偈曰： 真常不变，是名真道。 一切诸恶，悉皆远离。 譬如莲花，不生陆地。 滋湿之处，乃生是花。 浊泥之中，出诸染秽。 出诸贪着，汝行清静。 如比莲花，行此道时。 上德之子，众相具足。 按魔经灵符 上清境按魔经　终

The *Wuliang Jing* and *Lingfu* of the Shangqing Realm
*Wuliang Jing* concludes
Beneath the *Thirty-Six Revered Scriptures of the Supreme Lord* and the *Shangqing Realm Scriptures*:
*The Scripture of Refining Life*, *The Scripture of Numinous Secrets*, *The Scripture of Dispelling Demons*, *The Wuliang Jing*, *The Scripture of Subduing Demons*, *The Scripture of Ascending Communication*—the above six scriptures share a single fascicle.
*Shangqing Realm Scripture of Subduing Demons*, Chapter Eleven

After Heaven and Earth divided their forms, they were distinguished as pure and turbid: the pure became Heaven, the turbid became Earth. What marked their beginning? At the inception of the ten poles and thousand realms, perfected beings attained their stations, divided their forms to teach and transform, and only then did the measures of Heaven and Earth, yin and yang, sun and moon begin to operate. Once these measures were fixed, qi was then divided.

The East holds nine qi, where the Wood phase is gentle and compliant; the South holds three qi, where the Fire qi blazes fiercely. Though Fire qi is but three, it equals the nine qi of the Wood phase, together making twelve qi. The West holds seven qi, where the Metal phase is firm and solid; the North holds five qi, where the Water qi surges boundlessly. Though Water qi is but five, it equals the seven qi of the Metal phase, together making twelve qi. The remaining qi of the four directions—northeast, southeast, southwest, and northwest—are gathered as Brahma qi. The qi of the southeast is balanced, the qi of the northwest is balanced, harmonizing with the qi of the four directions. The qi of the northeast generates mountains, stones, great trees, and mighty beasts in abundance, while the qi of the southwest is scant, producing only treasures. The upper and lower positions, that is, the Earth phase of the Center, divide twelve qi. Rising, they form Heaven; stored, they become Earth. Thus, Heaven and Earth each possess thirty-six qi, and only then can they generate the myriad things.

Thereupon, the great deities of the ten poles and perfected beings, the celestial perfected and great sages, simultaneously bowed their heads and addressed the Heavenly Worthy: “We are fortunate to hear the true teaching, yet have not fathomed its profound mechanism. We only pray for your compassion to broadly expound it.”

The Heavenly Worthy said to the assembly: “The qi of Heaven and Earth moves in accord with numerical cycles, and these cycles also have their ends. Even the sun, moon, five planets, all celestial bodies, and the most sagely beings cannot escape calamitous cycles—how much less those of shallow learning who wish to avoid illness and harm?”

Thereupon, the entire assembly was struck with awe and fear. They bowed their heads and prostrated themselves again, asking: “If such calamities exist, how may they be averted?”

The Heavenly Worthy said: “You have all been fortunate in past lives, encountering good causes and hearing these teachings in manifold ways. Yet those born between Heaven and Earth are all deluded by the seven emotions and six desires, which confuse body and mind. Thus, they fail to hear the true Dao or awaken to the wondrous Dharma, and only accumulate transgressions, even when they repent. I shall now proclaim the true teaching for you, unfold the jade tones, turn the wheel of the true scriptures, and broadly present offerings. Whether on the *jiazi* day, the *gengshen* day, in the first month, the seventh month, or the tenth month—along with the eight solar terms, your life-destiny days, and birthdays—you should strictly maintain incense and fire, diligently uphold the Dharma, cultivate and gather the qi of the utmost truth, harmonize yin and yang, connect the blood vessels above and below, commune with Heaven and Earth, absorb the upright qi, dispel defilement and evil, prevent the arising of disasters and illness, eradicate ghosts and demons, ensure the five paths are unimpeded, and promote the flourishing of the six livestock. You should listen and receive these teachings, then teach others in turn, so that all later learners may hear of these good fruits, all attain auspiciousness, and every household and family share in the supreme goodness.

This scripture is named *Inconceivable*, and its merit and power are likewise inconceivable.”

Thereupon, the celestial immortals, the boundless perfected beings, the great sages of the utmost truth, the innumerable celestial deities, and the countless multitudes all heard these words and rejoiced. They vowed to uphold and protect the teaching, disseminate it throughout the world, and universally bestow its boundless benefits upon all. They cautioned that it must not be carelessly disclosed or treated with irreverence by unenlightened commoners of later ages, lest they fail to attain its blessed fruits.

Then a gāthā was spoken:
The true and constant, unchanging—
This is called the true Dao.
All manifold evils
Shall be wholly cast far away.
It is like the lotus flower,
Which does not grow on dry land.
Only in moistened places
Does this flower arise.
From the turbid mire,
It emerges unstained.
Free from all craving and attachment,
You walk in purity.
Like the lotus flower,
When you practice this Dao,
The child of supreme virtue
Shall possess all marks in full.

The *Lingfu of the Scripture of Subduing Demons* of the Shangqing Realm

chunks.original_text: 太上三十六部尊经上清境经下 炼生经．灵秘经．消魔经．无量经．按魔经．上通经　已上六经同卷 上清境上通经　第十二 虚无自然之炁化生天地，正炁变通，邪炁消灭。 夫正炁少则天地为邪炁失明。 惟邪炁多故能害正炁，正炁多则能禁邪炁。 此乃天地自然之炁。 夫一切邪炁，皆因正炁不行，邪炁得入。 凡修真之士当令邪炁消散，修无上至真之道，以得延年不死之法。 夫人受天之命，自有格法。 天地所私者三十岁，若此天地日月相推有余闰也。 若修存上道、至真之道、吐纳藏神之法，则与天地相升降，乃能不死。 是以固守形躯，不能通变，终无损坏，不若和神集气，与道合真，随物见形，莫迷正性，乃可长久。 夫人之生，一切算数衣食皆有定分。 虽有定分，亦在人修行上道，以增福禄。 如人春不耕田，至秋望收，及其无应，乃曰此乃天分，自不作善，以图福报，何异於是。 今日食人，而后日往食之，不名食人，名为寄粮。 今日代人负重，后日往寄重焉，不名代人负重，乃名寄工。 今日得人共谋，后日亦往与共谋，不名为助人，名为交功。 今日誉举於人，后日得人誉举，不名为誉举於人，乃名为更迭相称。 如此比类者众多，不可胜计。 今人略作善行，便望福报，何异於是。 至人上士则不然也。 人不佑吾，吾独阴佑之，必获善果报。 人人尽为恶行，我独为善，必获善报。 人不加功於我，我独乐加功於人，必获善报。 人不食饮於我，我独食饮於人，必获善报。 人尽习虚伪之行，以欺於我，我则以诚信待人，必获善报。 如此比类者众多，不可胜计。 今日有恩於人，必望其报，若或不报，即生怨恨，不能如是。 至人上士即求天泽； 中士即求人泽； 下愚亦不为善以应於天，亦不为功力以应於人，空欲求福，诚可羞耻。 如人今生富贵智慧，是人先世为善，应受此福。 若於今生富贵智慧，即生贪求，不肯布施，不作因果，则於后世，还复贫贱愚痴，现世因缘亦复如是。 而说偈曰： 解了空旨，解一切念。 必其会遇，同入妙门。 自在如意，如此等法。 无有穷尽，略明要说。 汝等当知，但行善念。 思念一切，幽冥之处。 皆得光明，无为妙相。 悉令具足，利益如是。 上通经灵符 上清境上通经　终
chunks.translated_text:
The *Thirty-Six Venerable Scriptures of the Most High: Scriptures of the Shangqing Realm, Volume III*
*Scripture of Refining Life, Scripture of Numinous Secrets, Scripture of Dispelling Demons, Scripture of the Immeasurable, Scripture of Subduing Demons, Scripture of Ascending Communication*—the above six scriptures share one scroll.
*Scripture of Ascending Communication of the Shangqing Realm*, Chapter Twelve

The qi of emptiness and spontaneity gives birth to Heaven and Earth; the upright qi transforms and communicates, while the deviant qi is dispelled. When upright qi is scant, Heaven and Earth are obscured by deviant qi. It is only because deviant qi abounds that it can harm upright qi; when upright qi abounds, it can restrain deviant qi. This is the spontaneous qi of Heaven and Earth.

All deviant qi arises because upright qi does not circulate, allowing deviant qi to enter. Those who cultivate the true Dao must cause deviant qi to dissipate and practice the supreme, most perfect Dao to attain the method of prolonging life and avoiding death.

Humans receive their mandate from Heaven, which has its own norms. Heaven and Earth privately grant thirty years; if this is exceeded, it is like the intercalary days added when the cycles of Heaven, Earth, sun, and moon align. If one cultivates the supreme Dao, the most perfect Dao, and the methods of exhaling, inhaling, and concealing the spirit, one ascends and descends with Heaven and Earth and thus attains immortality.

Those who rigidly guard their bodily form without adaptability will ultimately suffer no less harm than those who harmonize spirit and gather qi, unite with the Dao, and merge with the true, appearing in accordance with things without losing their true nature—only thus can they endure long.

Human life—all calculations, numbers, clothing, and food—has its allotted portion. Though this portion is fixed, it also depends on one’s cultivation of the supreme Dao to increase blessings and prosperity. It is like one who does not plow in spring yet expects a harvest in autumn; when nothing comes of it, they say it is Heaven’s portion. Those who do no good yet seek blessings differ not at all from this.

If today you eat another’s food, then tomorrow go to eat theirs, this is not called eating another’s food but "borrowing provisions." If today you carry another’s burden, then tomorrow go to have them carry yours, this is not called carrying another’s burden but "borrowing labor." If today you join another in planning, then tomorrow go to join them again, this is not called helping another but "exchanging merit." If today you praise another, then tomorrow receive their praise, this is not called praising another but "taking turns in commendation." Such comparisons are countless and beyond reckoning.

Yet people perform a small good deed and immediately expect blessings in return—how is this different? The perfected and superior person does not act thus. If others do not aid me, I alone secretly aid them, and I will surely receive good karmic retribution. If all others commit evil deeds, I alone do good, and I will surely receive good retribution. If others do not contribute to me, I alone delight in contributing to them, and I will surely receive good retribution. If others do not share food and drink with me, I alone share with them, and I will surely receive good retribution. If all others practice deceit and hypocrisy to deceive me, I alone treat them with sincerity and trust, and I will surely receive good retribution. Such comparisons are countless and beyond reckoning.

If today I show kindness to another and expect repayment, yet they do not repay, I grow resentful—this must not be. The perfected and superior person seeks the grace of Heaven; the middling person seeks the grace of others; the foolish do not perform good to respond to Heaven, nor do they exert effort to respond to others, yet vainly seek blessings—truly, this is shameful.

If one is wealthy, noble, and wise in this life, it is because they performed good deeds in a past life and now receive this blessing. If, in this life of wealth, nobility, and wisdom, one grows greedy and refuses to give alms or act in accordance with cause and effect, then in the next life they will return to poverty, lowliness, and ignorance—present karmic conditions are no different.

Then a gāthā was spoken:
Understanding the empty principle,
All thoughts are resolved.
When the meeting occurs,
Together you enter the wondrous gate.
At ease and as you wish—
Such are these methods.
Without end,
Briefly, the essentials are made clear.
You should know:
Simply practice good thoughts.
Contemplate all things,
Even in dark and hidden places.
All attain illumination,
The wondrous form of non-action.
All are made complete,
Such are the benefits.

*The Numinous Talisman of the Scripture of Ascending Communication*
*Scripture of Ascending Communication of the Shangqing Realm* concludes.

*The Thirty-Six Revered Scriptures of the Supreme Lord: The Scripture of the Great Clarity Realm*

*The Scripture of Great Clarity*
*The Scripture of Penetrating Vision*
*The Scripture of Assembled Immortals*
*The Scripture of the Abyssal Cavern*
*The Scripture of Inner Secrets*
*The Scripture of the True One*

*The above six scriptures share a single scroll.*

*The Scripture of the Great Clarity Realm of the Great Clarity*
*Chapter One*

The qi of August Heaven descends to give life,
The dark qi of Primal Earth ascends to nurture.
The qi of the Five Phases all generate one another,
The qi of the Four Seasons all interpenetrate.

All people under Heaven share the same nature.
The nature of Heaven is good—it gives birth to the myriad things without exception.
The nature of Earth is good—it nourishes the myriad things without exception.
The sage delights in ordering the world, yet truly models himself upon Heaven and Earth,
Thus the myriad things all receive his merit.

The great and good, the divine immortals and perfected persons,
Assist Heaven and Earth and dare not treat them lightly.
They revere, honor, cherish, and protect them,
All in harmony with the primordial qi,
In accord with the mind of Heaven,
In resonance with the earth’s terrain.
Thus they alone enjoy enduring fortune and know no misfortune.

The sages and worthies of antiquity pondered deeply and planned far ahead,
And so came to know the Dao of Heaven.
Thus they devoted themselves to good and dared not do evil.
Later generations, cunning and false, devoted themselves to evil deeds,
Yet wished to avoid misfortune and keep harm at bay—this cannot be.

Now I shall show you a method by which you may nurture yourself for all time,
And those who attain its utmost must never forget it for even a moment.
If people today wish to avoid misfortune and keep harm at bay,
To attain long life,
They should preserve self-love, self-regard, and self-affinity,
And by these means nurture themselves—only then can they be free from harm,
And their bodies long preserved.

Eating and drinking in due season, neither too much nor too little,
This is self-love and self-nurturance.
Closing the gates and dwelling within, not engaging in worldly affairs,
This is self-love and self-nurturance.
Seeking the root of the Dao all day long, content in poverty and lowliness, free from care,
This is self-love and self-nurturance.
If you take these as self-love and self-nurturance, it cannot be so.

The Dao of self-love lies in sincerity:
Though responding to the world, one is not seen to be disturbed;
Though abiding in stillness, one is not seen to be constrained.
Seeing others’ faults, one does not take them as faults,
But instead turns the gaze inward,
Never departing from this even for an instant—
This is the Dao of self-love.

The Dao of self-nurturance lies in freedom from care:
Moving by day and night, yet never enslaved by the heart-mind—
This is the Dao of self-nurturance.

If you can trust in this and practice it,
You will enjoy its benefits for ten thousand kalpas, without end.
Since before the separation of Heaven and Earth,
Beyond the Great Clarity,
Its measure cannot be reckoned.
Empty and spontaneous, it merges with true principle—
All things are without existence.

Were it not for my establishment of the Great Dharma and its universal proclamation,
You would never again hear such essential teachings.
It cannot be seen, cannot be heard;
If one speaks of its existence, no form is to be found.

chunks.original_text: 若言无，万物得之以生。 百亿变化，浩浩荡荡，无前无后，无圆无方，无去无来，无生无灭，无形无像，无高无下，自然空玄。 分形之后，方有天地、日月、星辰。 道法开明。 一切群生得闻是法，快乐自然，无有边际。 本性皆空，非观心照，等於虚空，自悟本性因缘，无有他想，平等无有异念。 若能志心念诵，深心受持，则能灭除一切宿障，皆得和合，厄难俱消，身心清静。 而说偈曰： 乐求胜法，断色断识。 具足行之，远欲远贪。 如是果报，无碍无障。 清静自然，无有余秽。 乐法为妻，爱经如玉。 惭愧之心，常生回向。 心意柔软，所说修行。 多增智慧，以为觉悟。 太清经灵符 太清境太清经　终
chunks.translated_text:
If one speaks of its nonexistence, all things receive it to come into being.
A hundred million transformations, vast and boundless,
Without before or after, without roundness or squareness,
Without going or coming, without birth or extinction,
Without form or image, without high or low—
Naturally empty and mysterious.

Only after the division of forms did Heaven and Earth arise,
Along with the sun, moon, and stars.
The Dao’s dharma unfolds in clarity.
All sentient beings who hear this teaching
Rejoice spontaneously, without limit.
Their fundamental nature is all empty—
Not through contemplation or illumination,
But equal to emptiness itself.
Awakening to the causes and conditions of their original nature,
Without other thoughts,
Equal and free from discriminating notions.

If one can single-mindedly recite and deeply uphold it,
All past obstructions will be extinguished,
All will harmonize,
All hardships and calamities will dissolve,
And body and mind will become pure.

Thus a gāthā says:
Delight in seeking the supreme Dharma,
Cut off form, cut off consciousness.
Fulfill these practices,
Distance desire, distance greed.
Such are the karmic fruits—
Unobstructed, without hindrance,
Pure and spontaneous,
Without remnant defilement.

Let the Dharma be your wife,
Cherish the sutras as jade.
With a heart of shame and repentance,
Constantly dedicate merit.
The heart-mind becomes gentle,
The teachings practiced as spoken.
Wisdom increases manifold,
Leading to awakening.

*Taiqing Scripture’s Numinous Talisman*
*Taiqing Realm, Taiqing Scripture*   Concluded.

chunks.original_text: 太上三十六部尊经太清境经上 太清经．彻视经．集仙经．洞渊经．内秘经．真一经　已上六经同卷 太清境彻视经　第二 学道修真，极道、济度，应当发心。 学道，从初至终，念念持斋，心心不退，忘心灭心，终始运意，行坐动形，寂若死灰，同於枯木，灭一切想，灭一切念，灭一切心，则随念随忘，神行不继。 归心於寂，真至道场，谓回心至道，翘真玄真至道，福降无穷，灾消未兆。 随力修行，惟竭一心。 丹心赡望十极，烧香礼拜，运身运心，归身归命，恭敬道祖三宝。 抽舍浄财，市诸香油、八珍、百味，营馔供养，请命道士，归心启告，恳祈至真。 如此运心，洗诸尘累，宿根罪恼、生死愆尤，等一至诚，斋修万善，内外洞彻，遍照万方，令诸众生同得赡视。 其福无量，不可思议。 若或斋戒，精思上道，万虑都泯，物我齐忘，虚室生白，真灵玄应。 此最上道所修。 若复有人发无上心，欲有归向，皆须持斋，始启本心，上救七祖穷魂，下及己身，禳灾度厄，增延福寿。 独运至诚，设斋开度，必使魂超九夜，爽炼三清，命远年长，神仙得道，思贤慕道，以彼之有开此之无，以彼之德开此之愚，破其悭贪，成其高行，清静身心，神气运用，往来无穷，无有滞塞。 祈告天地，启告明灵，须绝妖氛，精洁内外，皆欲泯其万境，息此六情，普洗烦心，徧证诸想。 故学道者不勤行业，不修斋戒，难达至真，徒劳山林。 凡持斋严奉戒律，务欲行道，归奉上清。 求真学道，炼气延生。 普及人天，徧资凡圣。 然上士所行，非凡下能奉。 夫金箓科品，保镇国祚，消灾延寿； 玉箓要品，保安社稷，永绝干戈； 黄箓正范，开魂度爽，徧及生死，圣凡同修，自然广济幽明，普救一切孤滞，徧救付切九幽苦爽； 三元、八节、本命、生辰，学道修身，谢愆求福，救诸三途五苦八难、牢狱疾病死亡之厄，持念神咒，辟斥瘟灾、时行疫疠、邪魅故气。 复有《金房》、《天宝》、《正一》、《太平》、《五炼》、《旨教》等经。 精勤行道，依奉正范，各具本经。 而说偈曰： 烧香建斋，功德无量。 甘露法食，解脱为浆。 示彼之有，现诸国土。 供养十方，无量道宝。 及诸众生，而修浄土。 教化众生，具习威仪。 施无畏力，发无上道。 普伸启请，而示其行。 彻视经灵符 太清境彻视经　终

*The Supreme Thirty-Six Revered Scriptures of the Taiqing Realm*
*Taiqing Scripture · Penetrating Vision Scripture · Assembled Immortals Scripture · Cavern Abyss Scripture · Esoteric Inner Scripture · True Unity Scripture*
*(The above six scriptures are contained in one scroll)*
*Taiqing Realm Penetrating Vision Scripture*   Second Scroll

To study the Dao and cultivate authenticity, to exhaust the Dao and deliver beings, one must first generate the heart-mind.

In studying the Dao, from beginning to end, thought after thought, maintain purity; heart after heart, never retreat. Forget the heart-mind, extinguish the heart-mind. From start to finish, direct intention. Whether in movement or stillness, in action or form, be as still as cold ashes, as silent as withered wood. Extinguish all perceptions, extinguish all thoughts, extinguish all heart-minds. Then, with each arising thought, let it be forgotten at once—spirit moves without hindrance.

Return the heart-mind to stillness, truly arrive at the Dao-ground. This is called turning the heart-mind toward the Dao, revering the profound and true Dao. Blessings descend without end, disasters dissolve before they manifest.

Practice according to one’s capacity, exhausting wholehearted devotion. With a cinnabar heart, gaze toward the ten directions. Burn incense, prostrate in worship, move body and heart-mind, surrender body and life, reverently honor the Dao Ancestor and the Three Treasures. Offer pure wealth to purchase various incenses, oils, the eight delicacies, and a hundred flavors. Prepare feasts for offerings, invite and command Daoist masters, return the heart-mind in supplication, earnestly beseech the Perfected.

Through such directed heart-mind, wash away all dust and burdens. Past-root transgressions, karmic afflictions, the errors of life and death—all are purified by utmost sincerity. Through fasting and myriad good deeds, inner and outer become thoroughly illuminated, universally illuminating the ten directions, enabling all beings to gain penetrating vision. Such merit is boundless, beyond conception.

If one observes the fast and precepts, concentrates the mind upon the supreme Dao, and dissolves the ten thousand concerns, forgetting both self and others, then in the empty chamber, clarity arises—true numinous response. This is the cultivation of the most supreme Dao.

If one generates the unsurpassed heart-mind, desiring to return and turn toward the Dao, one must first uphold the fast, awaken the original heart-mind, rescue the impoverished souls of the seven ancestors above, and extend to one’s own body below. Dispel disasters, cross over calamities, increase and prolong blessings and longevity. With solitary utmost sincerity, establish the fast and open the way for deliverance. Necessarily, souls transcend the nine nights, spirits refine in the Three Clarities. Life becomes distant and long, immortals attain the Dao. Aspiring to worthies, yearning for the Dao, use their abundance to open one’s lack, use their virtue to dispel one’s ignorance. Break through stinginess and greed, accomplish lofty conduct. Purify body and heart-mind, circulate spirit and qi. Coming and going without end, without obstruction or blockage.

Pray to Heaven and Earth, supplicate the luminous spirits. One must sever demonic influences, purify inner and outer. All desire to dissolve the ten thousand conditions, still the six emotions. Universally wash the troubled heart-mind, universally realize all perceptions.

Thus, those who study the Dao but do not diligently practice, who do not cultivate fasting and precepts, will find it difficult to reach the Perfected—idly laboring in the mountains and forests.

All who uphold the fast and strictly observe the precepts must desire to practice the Dao, return and honor the Supreme Clarity. Seek the true, study the Dao, refine qi, and prolong life. Universally extend to humans and heavens, universally aid the ordinary and the sagely.

Yet the conduct of superior practitioners is not something the common can uphold.

The Golden Register’s regulations and standards protect and secure the nation’s destiny, dispel disasters, and prolong life.
The Jade Register’s essential standards safeguard the altars of soil and grain, eternally ending warfare.
The Yellow Register’s correct model opens the way for souls, universally extending to life and death. Sages and ordinary alike cultivate together, naturally broadly delivering the hidden and manifest, universally rescuing all the solitary and obstructed, universally saving all suffering souls in the nine dark realms.

On the Three Primes, the eight solar terms, one’s original destiny, and birthdays, study the Dao and cultivate the body. Repent transgressions, seek blessings, rescue those in the three paths, the five sufferings, the eight difficulties, the calamities of imprisonment, illness, and death. Uphold and recite divine incantations to repel and expel pestilence, seasonal epidemics, demonic influences, and perverse qi.

Furthermore, there are scriptures such as the *Golden Chamber*, *Celestial Treasure*, *Orthodox Unity*, *Great Peace*, *Five Refinements*, and *Essential Teachings*. Diligently practice the Dao, follow the correct models, each possessing its own scripture.

Thus a gāthā says:
Burn incense, establish the fast—
Merit boundless.
The sweet dew of Dharma-food,
Liberation as its broth.
Manifest their abundance,
Reveal all lands.
Make offerings to the ten directions,
Boundless Dao-treasures.
And all beings,
Cultivating pure lands.
Teach and transform beings,
Mastering dignified conduct.
Bestow fearlessness,
Generate the unsurpassed Dao.
Universally extend supplication,
Demonstrating its practice.

*Penetrating Vision Scripture’s Numinous Talisman*
*Taiqing Realm Penetrating Vision Scripture*   Concluded.

chunks.original_text: 太上三十六部尊经太清境经上 太清经．彻视经．集仙经．洞渊经．内秘经．真一经　已上六经同卷 太清境集仙经　第三 夫行道皆有至行，当尽虔恭； 运志运心，使真灵降感； 行炁行神，令人天周布。 故入靖登坛，诵经礼拜，朝真谢罪，皆徧行道，绕坛三匝，并依本法、凡杂谢罪祈恩之会。 或为天地，或为帝王，或为国土，或为人民，或为祖世，或为己身，或为家门，或为三涂五苦，或为六道四生，皆须建斋行道，烧香礼拜，诵经赞咏。 凡所祈向，并须修斋； 凡国土有灾，兵革四兴，兆民疾疫、水旱死亡、一切凶危，皆须修斋。 若造经像，殿宇、宫馆、观室、洞府、岩舍等处，建立道场，或造钟磬、法器、天乐，成就一切功德，亦须恭敬，广设清斋，虔伸启请，诵经念道，断诸恶想，令内外增善，赞叹功德，不可思议。 凡读诵经文，礼拜行香，一依经典。 三捻上香，三礼，三度九礼，端身稽首，赞咏玉音，令其和畅，无使不齐。 欲其一切见闻皆悉欢喜，同声赞叹，敷扬道法，如斯功德，是不可思议，是无量无边智慧。 亦复以是功德，过往宗亲，俱起浄境，见世眷属，受诸快乐，当来托生，常居福地浄土，衣食常自然。 是故发是浄心，普令庄严。 种种香花灯烛罗列供养，普献於三界诸天、四司五帝、三官九府、一百二十曹僚，虔伸恳请，注福延生，消灾度厄，营护臣身，普及一切有情，天道、地道、人道、畜生道、饿鬼道、地狱道，一切苦恼普皆消灭。 更能持斋，精心用意，绝其贪取，不着声色，随力布施经像，劝人广作福缘，如斯利益，乃为不可思议，七世父母离苦升天，逍遥快乐，合门和睦，世世昌炽，与道因缘，罪累荡除，福慧圆满，天下太平，万国和同，一切众生兔离诸苦，同入正真。 至心稽首无上正真三宝，赞咏功德，为诸来生作诸善缘，开於愚昧，仰受圣恩，百福庄严，万善云集，资於群生，离苦解脱，供养尊礼，慈悲教典。 永愿受持，旦夕烧香，以求福利。 流传於世，无有懈怠。 而说偈曰： 善方便智，随意能现。 成就群生，通达无碍。 离有离无，无有彼我。 常持善愿，劝人发心。 令求胜善，去远恶道。 得无畏力，清静法果。 一切无碍，普入法门。 皆有是心，悉皆得度。 集仙经灵符、 太清境集仙经　终 太上三十六部尊经太清境经上 太清经．彻视经．集仙经．洞渊经．内秘经．真一经　已上六经同卷 太清境洞渊经　第四 大洞《太清经》 中宝云玉座，五色祥云遍满虚空，无有穷尽。 诸天大圣及诸仙众会集其中，洞明奥理。 时有天童、天女奉宝来献，供养正真，愿请大慈广垂方便，讲说诸经，散布道流。 乃至千经万论、总是妙义，能令一切皆得解悟。 天尊是时遂为众曰：凡道士、女冠出家之后，须持经戒、法录，诣师参受，当竭至诚，得经之后，不敢怨道咎师，泄慢灵文，殃及七祖，受考冥司。 若有至士罄竭丹诚，德业清素，立行正直，世代所称，身心俱浄。 未闻道典秘要，宜精心向道，求师开度，超登福果，进无上道。 既备经法，同心一意，必期冥感，不得外假威仪，内怀自足，妄称此长彼短，妄言此是彼非，嫉人胜己。 常怀劝诱，莫笑未达。 如斯智慧，日日增长，以至无尽智慧，难可称扬。

**Supreme Thirty-Six Divisions of Revered Scriptures: *Taiqing Realm Scriptures* (Volume I)**

**Taiqing Scripture, *Penetrating Vision Scripture, Assembly of Immortals Scripture, Cavern Abyss Scripture, Esoteric Scripture, True Unity Scripture*** – The above six scriptures share one scroll.

**Taiqing Realm *Assembly of Immortals Scripture*** (Chapter Three)

All who practice the Dao possess the utmost conduct; they must cultivate utmost reverence. They mobilize will and heart, invoking the descent of true numina. They circulate qi and spirit, causing their influence to pervade heaven and earth. Thus, entering the oratory to ascend the altar, reciting scriptures and prostrating, paying homage to the Perfected and repenting transgressions—all these are comprehensive Dao-practices. Circumambulating the altar thrice, they follow the original methods for all assemblies of repentance, supplication, or gratitude.

Whether for heaven and earth, the emperor, the realm, the people, ancestral generations, oneself, one’s family, the Three Wretched Paths and Five Sufferings, or the Six Destinies and Four Births—all require the establishment of fasts, the practice of the Dao, the burning of incense, and prostration with scripture-recitation and hymns. For all supplications, one must observe the fast. When the realm suffers calamities—war raging on all sides, the people afflicted by pestilence, drought, flood, or death—all dire perils necessitate the observance of fasts.

When creating scriptures or images, constructing halls, palaces, monasteries, grottoes, or mountain retreats, establishing Daoist sanctuaries, or crafting bells, chimes, ritual instruments, or celestial music—all such meritorious deeds require reverence. One must broadly establish pure fasts, earnestly extend supplications, recite scriptures and invoke the Dao, sever all evil thoughts, augment inner and outer goodness, and extol boundless merit.

For all scripture-recitation, prostration, and incense-offering, one must follow the scriptures precisely: thrice offering incense, thrice bowing, thrice performing the ninefold prostration, straightening the body and touching the head to the ground, chanting the jade-like tones in harmonious accord, ensuring no discord. Thus, all who see or hear shall rejoice together, praising in unison, propagating the Dao and its teachings. Such merit is inconceivable, an immeasurable and boundless wisdom.

Moreover, through this merit, past ancestors ascend to pure realms, present kin enjoy bliss, and future rebirths dwell perpetually in blessed pure lands, where clothing and sustenance arise naturally. Therefore, cultivate this pure heart and universally adorn all. Array myriad incense, flowers, lamps, and candles as offerings, universally presenting them to the deities of the Three Realms, the Four Offices and Five Emperors, the Three Officials and Nine Bureaus, and the one hundred twenty divine ministers. Earnestly extend supplications to invoke blessings, prolong life, dispel disasters, and transcend calamities, safeguarding this servant’s body and universally benefiting all sentient beings—those of the heavenly, earthly, human, animal, hungry ghost, and hellish destinies—dissolving all suffering.

Further, by maintaining fasts with focused intent, relinquishing greed and attachment, abstaining from sensory indulgence, and donating scriptures or images according to one’s means, one encourages others to broadly cultivate karmic affinities. Such benefits are inconceivable: seven generations of parents escape suffering and ascend to heaven, enjoying carefree bliss; households live in harmony, flourishing across generations; karmic bonds with the Dao dissolve transgressions, perfecting virtue and wisdom; the world attains great peace, all nations harmonize; and all beings escape suffering, entering the true and correct.

With utmost sincerity, bow to the Supreme, Correct, and True Three Treasures, extolling their merit. For all future lives, establish karmic affinities of goodness, dispelling ignorance and receiving sagely grace. A hundred blessings adorn, ten thousand virtues gather like clouds, benefiting all beings, liberating them from suffering. Make offerings and pay reverence to the compassionate teachings. May one forever uphold them, burning incense morning and night to seek blessings. May they circulate throughout the world without negligence.

A gāthā says:
With skillful expedient wisdom,
Manifesting as one wills,
Accomplishing all beings,
Unobstructed and thorough.
Beyond existence and non-existence,
Without self or other,
Constantly uphold good vows,
Encouraging others to awaken.
Let them seek supreme goodness,
Far from evil paths.
Attain fearlessness,
The pure fruit of the Dharma.
All unobstructed,
Universally enter the Dharma-gates.
All who possess this heart
Shall all attain liberation.

*Numinous Talisman of the Assembly of Immortals Scripture*
*Taiqing Realm Assembly of Immortals Scripture* Concluded.

**Supreme Thirty-Six Divisions of Revered Scriptures: *Taiqing Realm Scriptures* (Volume I)**

**Taiqing Scripture, *Penetrating Vision Scripture, Assembly of Immortals Scripture, Cavern Abyss Scripture, Esoteric Scripture, True Unity Scripture*** – The above six scriptures share one scroll.

**Taiqing Realm *Cavern Abyss Scripture*** (Chapter Four)

Within the *Great Cavern Taiqing Scripture*, jeweled clouds and jade thrones, five-colored auspicious clouds fill the empty sky without end. The great sages of heaven and the assembled immortals gather therein, illuminating profound principles. Celestial youths and maidens present treasures in offering, venerating the Correct and True, beseeching the Great Compassion to broadly extend expedient means, expounding the scriptures and disseminating the Dao’s currents. Even myriad scriptures and ten thousand treatises—all are wondrous meanings, enabling all to attain understanding and awakening.

Thereupon, the Heavenly Worthy addressed the assembly: After Daoist priests and nuns leave the household life, they must uphold scriptures, precepts, and ritual codes, seeking transmission from a master. They must exhaust utmost sincerity. After receiving scriptures, they dare not resent the Dao or blame the master, nor carelessly divulge or slight sacred texts, lest calamity befall their seven ancestors, subjecting them to judgment in the netherworld courts.

If there are those of utmost integrity who exhaust their cinnabar sincerity, whose virtue and conduct are pure and simple, whose actions are upright, and whose generations are renowned—whose bodies and minds are both pure—yet have not encountered the secret essentials of the Dao’s canon, they should earnestly turn toward the Dao, seeking a master to initiate and deliver them, ascending to blessed fruits and advancing toward the unsurpassed Dao.

Once possessing scriptures and methods, they must unite in heart and intent, awaiting numinous response. They must not outwardly feign dignified conduct while inwardly harboring complacency, falsely praising themselves and disparaging others, claiming this is right and that is wrong, or envying those superior to themselves. They should constantly encourage and guide, never mocking the unenlightened. Such wisdom shall grow day by day, culminating in boundless wisdom, difficult to extol.

chunks.original_text: 夫三洞大经，传有年限，上圣以四万劫方傅上真、上仙； 神仙以四千年，或千年、或七百年； 凡世以四十年。 若能明是经典，实为不可思议。 贤智尚以为难遇，而况於末学道浅，岂易得哉？ 若有学士倾心期！ 於一会，宜须尽心，永持盟誓，精感神明，不负初心，久而不怠，亦能进阶仙品，成无上道。 惟恐无志，中道自废，反覆害道，非惟无功，又且有罪。 汝等宜信吾言，遵守教法，广度流传。 凡有祈请，皆须依法受持，端心正容，罗列次第，从容雅步，听十二时钟，持花赞引，持节执炉，把旛建谛，雍容上坛。 凡道士、女官自为及为人祈恩请福，忏罪消灾，皆须至心一意，至诚恳祷，关启白言，皆调畅声气，使文理正直，不得戏弄音曲，高下作声，词音混杂，令众怪异。 或行法事，或礼谢赞唱、讲说，皆须习，使流利，不应临时停废，文理断续。 非惟关奏，有失威仪，抑且又招灾咎。 每事专心，执按本格仪范，当获福报、无量无边种种利益。 天真欣悦，众法和美，如斯功德，永臻福庆。 而说偈曰： 浄为法果，大可称扬。 浄为法药，救一切病。 浄心为最，安乐为至。 浄严等一，无有边际。 世间道法，消除众毒。 先救饿渴，化彼众生。 令得成就，了断诸惑。 常存好事，得法深重。 洞渊经灵符 太清境洞渊经　终

The great scriptures of the Three Caverns are transmitted only after set durations: the highest sages bestow them upon perfected transcendents and superior immortals after forty thousand kalpas; divine immortals after four thousand years, or a thousand years, or seven hundred years; and in the mundane world, after forty years. Should one truly comprehend these scriptures, it would be deemed inconceivable. Even the wise and discerning deem them rare to encounter—how much more so for those of shallow learning in the Dao, who could scarcely attain them? If there be scholars who wholeheartedly devote themselves to a single assembly, they must exert their utmost sincerity, uphold their vows in perpetuity, and with refined devotion move the divine spirits, never betraying their original resolve. Persisting without slack, they too may ascend to the ranks of immortality and attain the unsurpassed Dao. Yet one must fear the lack of resolve, lest halfway they abandon themselves, repeatedly harming the Dao—not only achieving no merit, but incurring transgression. You all should trust my words, adhere to the teachings and precepts, and widely propagate them.

For all invocations and petitions, one must receive and uphold them in accordance with the method: compose the mind, assume a dignified demeanor, arrange the sequence in order, proceed with graceful steps, heed the twelve double-hours’ bell, hold flowers and lead with hymns, grasp the ritual tablets and wield the censer, raise the banners and establish the truths, and ascend the altar with solemn composure. Whether Daoist priests or female officials perform rites for themselves or others—seeking blessings, repenting sins, or dispelling calamities—they must do so with wholehearted sincerity, earnestly praying, addressing and invoking with clear and harmonious speech, ensuring the text and reasoning are upright. They must not jest with melodies, modulate their voices in exaggerated rises and falls, or mingle their words and tones to provoke astonishment. Whether conducting rituals, offering thanks, chanting praises, or expounding teachings, all must be practiced until fluent. They should not falter or break off midway, leaving the text and reasoning disjointed. Such lapses not only disrupt the solemnity of the invocation but may also invite misfortune. In every matter, one must concentrate, adhere to the original forms and rituals, and thereby gain boundless, immeasurable blessings and manifold benefits. The celestial perfected will rejoice, all methods will harmonize in beauty, and through such merit, eternal felicity shall be attained.

And the gatha says:
Purity is the fruit of the Dharma, greatly to be extolled.
Purity is the medicine of the Dharma, curing all ills.
Purity of heart is supreme, tranquility and bliss are ultimate.
Purity and solemnity are equal, boundless and without limit.
The worldly methods of the Dao dispel all poisons.
First, they relieve hunger and thirst, transforming all beings,
Enabling them to achieve perfection and sever all delusions.
Ever abiding in good deeds, one attains profound depth in the Dharma.

The *Wondrous Talismans of the Abyssal Cavern Scripture*
The *Supreme Clarity Scripture of the Abyssal Cavern* concludes.

chunks.original_text: 太上三十六部尊经太清境经上 太清经．彻视经．集仙经．洞渊经．内秘经．真一经　已上六经同卷 太清境内秘经　第五 诸经功德，历劫秘藏华堂宫室宝蕴之内，不敢轻泄於下世，今幸得闻。 若有受持之人行道演说，持诵真经，皆当以五色花置笥中，每行道唱善，则四散虚空，名为散花，以陈志愿。 读诵此经，皆当先绕经一匝，捻香礼拜，三礼，平座，行浄水，执香熏浄行经，思神集气，赞咏归依，恭伸启请，方获福报，不可思议。 天真隐秘，不明於世，所以修真养气之士难知要典。 我今略明，汝当听受，无复异念，乃可得闻。 至士以不语为养气，此保气也，则失之昏； 以入清出浊为养气，此换气也，则失之虚。 昏则气散神狂，真灵自厌，终无所归。 虚者丹田无宝，徒劳吐纳，终不能住。 此皆非养气，所以招致病，认为胎息，自伤性命。 如此之流，误者甚多。 上咽下搐，聚气修神，指作还丹，自伤性命。 如此之流，误者甚多。 绵绵若存，委气而和神，出息入息，要住，纳之不出，闭气而炼形，一咽复一咽，双收两夹，以虚咽为法，是借气取水，灌溉之术也，认为已固身田，反以自虚。 如此之流，误者甚多。 正坐升身，气满四大，血络通行，营护和畅，是布气焚身之法。 若此皆非养气，而认为凝神坐忘，反丧身害命。 如此之流，误者甚多。 凡此等事者，皆术也，术立则道消。 所谓修真者，当因术以明道，而至於道； 因天地生成而求乎道，则得乎道。 失道者，以虚无自然之气而生混沌而全乎道，混沌凿七窍而混沌死，而有天地，天地判而难全乎道。 天地会阴阳而动，神气发用，生人、禽兽； 神气静而生草木、山石。 及其人以男女会合而生，草木以种，则天地化生之机已灭。 凡应以术，是无天地之机，安可言道？ 夫修真养气是全道，应天地气为修真养气，以至湛然常应常静，处於无事而若有事，处於有事而若无事，可言道矣。 而说偈曰： 此道一行，而无有形。
chunks.translated_text:
The *Supreme Thirty-Six Revered Scriptures of the Great Clarity Realm: The Great Clarity Realm Scripture*
*The Great Clarity Scripture, The Penetrating Vision Scripture, The Immortals’ Collected Scripture, The Abyssal Cavern Scripture, The Esoteric Inner Scripture, The Scripture of True Unity*—the above six scriptures share a single scroll.

*The Esoteric Inner Scripture of the Great Clarity Realm*, Fifth Scroll

The merits of all scriptures have been concealed for kalpas within the jeweled treasuries of the Flowery Hall Palace, never lightly disclosed to the lower world. Now, by good fortune, they may be heard. Those who receive and uphold them, practicing the Dao, expounding their teachings, and reciting the true scriptures, should place five-colored flowers in a container. With each practice of the Dao and chanting of goodness, scatter them into the empty void—this is called "scattering flowers," offered to declare one’s vows.

When reciting this scripture, one should first circumambulate it once, hold incense, bow in reverence, perform the three prostrations, sit upright, purify with water, and waft incense to sanctify the scripture. Concentrate the spirit, gather qi, praise and take refuge, and humbly make entreaties—only then may one attain blessings beyond conception.

The celestial perfected keep their secrets hidden, unknown to the world, which is why those who cultivate truth and nurture qi rarely grasp these essential texts. I shall now briefly elucidate them; you must listen and receive without distraction, that you may truly hear.

The superior adept regards silence as the cultivation of qi—this is preserving qi, yet it leads to dullness. To inhale purity and exhale impurity is the exchange of qi, yet it leads to emptiness. Dullness scatters qi and maddens the spirit; the true numen grows weary and finds no refuge. Emptiness leaves the cinnabar field barren; breath control is labored in vain, and qi cannot abide. These are not true methods of nurturing qi but invite illness, mistaken for "embryonic breathing," harming one’s nature and life. Many err in this way.

Swallowing and gulping, gathering qi to refine the spirit, pointing to it as "returning the elixir"—this harms one’s nature and life. Many err in this way.

To exist as if continuous, entrusting qi to harmonize with the spirit, exhaling and inhaling with intent to abide, drawing qi inward without release, sealing breath to temper the form—one swallow after another, gathering both flanks, taking empty swallowing as the method—this is borrowing qi to draw water, an irrigation technique, yet deemed a means to secure the body’s field, only to deplete oneself. Many err in this way.

Sitting upright, raising the body, filling the four great elements with qi, circulating the blood and channels, nourishing and protecting with harmony—this is the method of "dispersing qi to burn the body." Yet these are not true ways of nurturing qi but are mistaken for "congealing the spirit in seated oblivion," only to lose the body and harm life. Many err in this way.

All such practices are mere techniques; where technique is established, the Dao vanishes. Those who cultivate truth must use technique to illuminate the Dao and thereby attain it. Seeking the Dao through the generation of heaven and earth, one may grasp it. Those who lose the Dao rely on the qi of emptiness and spontaneity to engender chaos, yet chaos alone preserves the Dao. When chaos is pierced to form the seven apertures, chaos dies, and heaven and earth arise. Once heaven and earth are divided, the Dao is difficult to preserve in full.

Heaven and earth unite yin and yang to move; spirit and qi activate, giving rise to humans and beasts. When spirit and qi are still, grasses, trees, mountains, and stones emerge. Yet when humans are born through the union of male and female, and grasses and trees through seeds, the mechanism of heaven and earth’s transformation is already extinguished. To rely on technique is to lack the mechanism of heaven and earth—how can one speak of the Dao?

Cultivating truth and nurturing qi is to preserve the Dao in full. Aligning with the qi of heaven and earth to cultivate truth and nurture qi, one may attain profound stillness, ever-responsive yet ever-quiet, abiding in non-action as if in action, and in action as if in non-action—only then may one speak of the Dao.

And the gatha says:
This Dao is practiced as one,
Yet without form.

chunks.original_text: 安可有术，略明其粗。 一切众生，咸皆解脱。 以劝导人，令入真门。 是可希有，现作无穷。 用之不尽，因以导人。 施以无畏，学者正意。 莫迷一术，结种种愿。 内秘经灵符 太清境内秘经　终 太上三十六部尊经太清境经上 太清经．彻视经．集仙经．洞渊经．内秘经．真一经　已上六经同卷 太清境真一经　第六 真一之气因道而生，受气而生，受气而成，而谓之命。 自真一禀形，能全其性。 性命之动，皆主乎心。 心若有所思，则谓之意。 意之运动，有所思虑，而谓之志。 思虑以至成事，而无不固者，谓之智。 智周万物谓之虑。 动以营身谓之魂。 静以镇身谓之魄。 流行骨肉谓之血。 保形养神集气谓之精。 神和而悦，气清而快，谓之和。 神集气而后有所营护，总括百骸，谓之身。 众象备见谓之形。 块然不动谓之质。 形貌可则谓之体。 小大有分谓之躯。 众思不得谓之神。 漠然变化谓之灵。 气来入身谓之生，气去于形谓之死。 所以通生谓之道。 道者，有而无形，无而有精，变化不测通神。 群生自得其生，自得其养，所以全道乎粗，亦得其生成，皆当自然，不可逆理。 汝等当依吾言，以广教化，不得邪生别见，以乱正真。 劝人修道，即以修心； 教人修心，自可见道。 道不可得见，因心以见； 道不可得闻，因心以闻。 夫闻见於道，皆因以心； 心不可常，用道以守。 若非以道守，随心闻见，则是入邪宗，永不解脱，永不闻法。 是以诸天仙众、诸天大圣至真天真，无鞅数众曾闻我法，方得知道。 若更能虚心，以遣其实，无心以遣其有，定心以令其不动，静心以令其不乱，正心以令其不邪，清心以令其不浊，浄心以令其不秽。 汝等非不明此，而欲常勤其行，莫令退悔，莫令障碍。 当知一切法皆应如是。 若於其中，复生他见，自迷正道，无复见解，别生思想，以为智慧，迷乱身心，反不知道，反伤正气。 如此众等，是其先世得是因缘尚浅，故於正教自生障碍。 我今演说，汝皆当明是心，转转教人，令其心直，不得反覆。 心平无复高下，心明终不暗昧，心通无有滞碍，即於清静身心，解悟诸心，了见一切。 如是功德具足，不可思议，不可称量，悉皆圆满。 而说偈曰： 汝等一切，未见未闻，从今以去，悉见悉闻。 当归依道，行此事时，叹其功德，入功德海。 无为会道，念心发心，无量因缘，无量果报。 无为之法，成道名字，无碍解脱，是名真道。 真一经灵符 太清境真一经　终

How can there be techniques? Only a rough outline may be shown. All sentient beings may attain liberation. By exhorting and guiding others, one leads them into the gate of truth. This is rare and wondrous, manifesting boundlessly, inexhaustible in its use, and thus employed to guide others. Bestowing fearlessness and rectifying the intentions of learners, let none be deluded by a single technique or entangled in manifold vows.

The *Inner Secret Scripture of Talismans* within the Taiqing Realm concludes here.

**Taiqing Realm Scripture of the Thirty-Six Venerable Scriptures**
*Taiqing Scripture, Thorough Vision Scripture, Assembly of Immortals Scripture, Cavern Abyss Scripture, Inner Secret Scripture, True One Scripture*—the above six scriptures share a single fascicle.

**Taiqing Realm True One Scripture, Chapter Six**
The qi of the True One arises from the Dao, receives qi to come into being, and is perfected by qi—this is called *ming* (life-destiny). From the True One, form is endowed, and one’s *xing* (nature) may be preserved whole. The movement of *xing* and *ming* is governed by the heart. When the heart engages in thought, it is called *yi* (intention). The movement of *yi*, when it involves contemplation, is called *zhi* (will). When contemplation culminates in accomplishment, with nothing unconsolidated, it is called *zhi* (wisdom). Wisdom that encompasses all things is called *lü* (deliberation). That which moves to nourish the body is called *hun* (ethereal soul). That which stills to stabilize the body is called *po* (corporeal soul). That which flows through bones and flesh is called *blood*. Preserving form, nurturing spirit, and gathering qi is called *jing* (essence). When spirit harmonizes and delights, and qi is pure and unburdened, it is called *he* (harmony). When spirit gathers qi and thereafter engages in nurture and protection, encompassing the hundred bones, it is called *shen* (body). When all images are fully manifest, it is called *xing* (form). When inert and unmoving, it is called *zhi* (substance). When form and appearance are regulated, it is called *ti* (frame). When small and large are distinct, it is called *qu* (trunk). When myriad thoughts cannot grasp it, it is called *shen* (spirit). When vast and transformative, it is called *ling* (numinous). When qi enters the body, it is called *sheng* (life); when qi departs from form, it is called *si* (death). That which pervades life is called the Dao.

The Dao exists yet has no form; it is formless yet possesses essence. Its transformations are unfathomable, pervading the numinous. All living beings naturally attain their life and sustenance, thus preserving the Dao in its rough outline. They also attain their generation and completion, all of which should be natural and not contrary to principle. You should follow my words to broadly propagate the teachings, without allowing deviant views to arise and disrupt true reality. Exhort others to cultivate the Dao, which is to cultivate the heart. Teach others to cultivate the heart, and the Dao may be seen thereby. The Dao cannot be seen directly—it is seen through the heart. The Dao cannot be heard directly—it is heard through the heart. All hearing and seeing of the Dao arise through the heart. The heart cannot be constant; it is guarded by the Dao. If not guarded by the Dao, and one follows the heart’s hearing and seeing, this is to enter a heterodox school, never to attain liberation or hear the Dharma.

Thus, the multitudes of heavenly immortals, the great sages and perfected beings of the heavens, and the countless hosts of celestial perfected ones—having heard my teachings—came to know the Dao. If one can further empty the heart to dispel its substance, be without heart to dispel its existence, stabilize the heart to render it unmoving, still the heart to render it unconfused, rectify the heart to render it unerring, purify the heart to render it unstained, and cleanse the heart to render it unpolluted—you are not unaware of this. Yet you must constantly diligently practice, without allowing retrogression or obstruction. Know that all dharmas should be thus. If, within this, deviant views arise, one strays from the true Dao, loses all insight, and generates separate thoughts, mistaking them for wisdom—confusing body and mind, one turns away from the Dao and harms the true qi.

Such multitudes, due to their shallow karmic conditions in past lives, create obstructions to the true teaching. I now expound this so that you may all understand the heart, and in turn teach others, guiding their hearts to be upright, without reversal. When the heart is level, without high or low; when the heart is bright, never dim or obscure; when the heart is unobstructed, without hindrance—then, in the purity of body and mind, one awakens to all hearts and perceives all things clearly. Such merit is complete, inconceivable, immeasurable, and perfectly fulfilled.

And the gatha says:
You who have not seen, have not heard—
From this day forth, all shall see, all shall hear.
When you take refuge in the Dao and practice this,
Praise its merit, enter the ocean of merit.
In non-action, meet the Dao;
With mindful resolve, the mind arises.
Boundless causes and conditions,
Boundless karmic retribution.
The Dharma of non-action
Is called the name of Dao-perfection.
Unobstructed liberation—
This is the true Dao.

**Talismans of the True One Scripture**
*Taiqing Realm True One Scripture* concludes here.

chunks.original_text: 太上三十六部尊经太清境经下 集灵经.中精经.无量意经.集宫经.黄庭经.小劫经　己上六经同卷 太清境集灵经　第七 天真大圣、至真大神、十方无极无量飞天神王及诸仙众同会其所。 汝今得道，当知无上胜因，是诸妙果，同其回向，集灵资道，神气相合。 若欲闻是要理，当在奉行吾法，以引一切未来皆知吾教。 夫人身本皆同有，自以七情六欲伤其本性，所以不闻吾法。 汝今发愿，度诸一切，得如是无量智慧真心，少思少念，少欲少事，少语少笑，少愁少乐，少喜少怒，少好少恶，故灵光不乱，神气不狂，方可奉道。 於其众中复有多思者，其神必殆，多念者其志必散，多欲者其气必损，多事者其形必役，多语者其气必弱，多笑者其脏必伤，多愁者其血必散，多乐者其气必溢，多喜则百神交错，多怒则百脉不定，多好则昏迷不理，多恶则憔悴无欢，则於其原不洁，所学不精，其气自散。 纵遇明师，不解正理，虽知养生之方，不悟修行之法，则所见所闻皆非正道。 虽知炼神之意，不明得道之要，则所学所讲皆非正论。 不多言说，而在得法。 是故修真之士志在玄元而甘寂寞，虽运动常见其静定，虽静定常见其运动，一日气满功盈，五气调顺，以至朝元，三花聚顶，血凝气聚，万神朝真，俱在上宫，富贵华盛，楼台殿阁，玉童天童，玉女天女，十二辰童，十二辰女，自鼓天乐，香花旛盖，罗列笙簧，似非人世庄严，名为至真上境，是自身上宫。 未能解脱，贪着故魂，神散乱，若是於此中稍萌一念，自落迷津。 上学之士当於此时不动一切境地，但发无上心，但修无量福； 但发无上心，但修无量慧； 但发无上心，但修无量善。 但发无碍自在意，欲广及十方，无量无边一切未来皆闻正道，不起一切贪心，不起一切邪见，不起一切梦想，不起一切障碍，不起一切烦恼，不起一切染着情欲。 如是正法大不可思议，大不可称说，方知正统出於杳冥，无求小验，以迷真性。 而说偈曰： 一切归依，总是一缘。 若复有人，德行具足。 舍有为心，发无为意，不远尊德，不亲不仁， 思念三宝，无时暂舍，终不悔意，诸行圆满， 具足成道，无复染滞。 汝等当知，如此经典。 集灵经灵符 太清境集灵经　终 太上三十六部尊经太清境经下 集灵经.中精经.无量意经.集宫经.黄庭经.小劫经　己上六经同卷 太清境中精经　第八 我於尔时欲明正道，既放五色光明，徧满三千大千世界，种种异类世界，天堂地狱，悉於中见； 复有十方天尊、诸大真仙悉於中见； 生死苦乐，福报多少，悉於中见； 修道阶梯，悉於中见； 苦乐国土，亦於中见。 十方来众犹如微尘，不可称数，悉见如是光明； 地狱众苦，无量无边，亦见如是光明。 时太极真人以大慈大悲大智慧力哀愍众生，见诸苦乐不同，天堂地狱受报差等，惟愿天尊至圣为众宣说，救护一切，作大利益，令得解脱，永离恶缘，速生浄土。 天尊告十方天尊曰：汝今以我之气化身下降东方。 若有一劫人民见世受苦，则曰玉清降福天尊救度一切灾难。 过往魂爽未得超生，则曰玉宝皇上天尊救度一切沉滞。 南方延寿益算天尊济生，玄真万福天尊度死； 西方八卦护身天尊济生，太妙至极天尊度死；
chunks.translated_text:
**The Supreme Thirty-Six Revered Scriptures of the Taiqing Realm**
*Collected Spirits Scripture, Central Essence Scripture, Immeasurable Mind Scripture, Collected Palaces Scripture, Yellow Court Scripture, Lesser Kalpa Scripture*
*(The above six scriptures share a single scroll)*

**Taiqing Realm Collected Spirits Scripture** (Chapter Seven)

The Heavenly Perfected Great Sages, the Utmost Perfected Great Spirits, the Flying Heavenly Spirit-Kings of the Ten Directions and the Boundless Immeasurable, and all the assembled immortals gather in this place. Now that you have attained the Dao, you should know the supreme and victorious causes, which are the wondrous fruits. Together, turn your merits toward the gathering of spirits to aid the Dao, so that spirit and qi unite as one.

If you wish to hear these essential principles, you must uphold and practice my teachings, guiding all beings of the future to know my doctrine. All human bodies share the same original nature, yet through the seven emotions and six desires, they harm their fundamental nature and thus fail to hear my Dharma.

Now that you have vowed to deliver all beings, you have gained such immeasurable wisdom and true heart. Cultivate few thoughts, few intentions, few desires, few affairs, few words, few laughs, few sorrows, few joys, few likes, few dislikes. Only then will your spirit-light remain undisturbed, your spirit and qi unconfused, and you may properly follow the Dao.

Among the multitude, those who think excessively will surely endanger their spirit; those who contemplate excessively will scatter their will; those with many desires will deplete their qi; those entangled in many affairs will exhaust their form; those who speak excessively will weaken their qi; those who laugh excessively will harm their viscera; those who grieve excessively will disperse their blood; those who indulge in excessive joy will cause their qi to overflow; those who rejoice excessively will disorder the hundred spirits; those who rage excessively will unsettle the hundred meridians; those who covet excessively will fall into confusion and disorder; those who hate excessively will become emaciated and joyless. Their original nature will be impure, their studies imprecise, and their qi will scatter of itself.

Even if they encounter an enlightened teacher, they will not comprehend the true principle. Though they may know the methods of nurturing life, they will not awaken to the practice of cultivation. Thus, all they see and hear will not be the true Dao. Though they may understand the intent of refining the spirit, if they do not grasp the essentials of attaining the Dao, all they study and expound will not be the correct teaching.

One need not speak at length to obtain the Dharma. Therefore, those who cultivate the truth set their minds on the mysterious origin and willingly embrace solitude. Though active, they always appear serene and settled; though settled, they always appear active. When their qi is full and their merit complete, the five qi harmonize and flow smoothly, ascending to the origin. The Three Flowers gather at the crown, blood congeals and qi collects, the ten thousand spirits pay homage to the Perfected, all dwelling in the Upper Palace. There, wealth and honor flourish, pavilions and halls rise in splendor, jade lads and heavenly youths, jade maidens and heavenly maidens, the twelve celestial lads and twelve celestial maidens—all play celestial music, waft incense and flowers, unfurl banners and canopies, array reed pipes and flutes. Such magnificence transcends the mortal world, known as the Supreme Perfected Upper Realm, the Upper Palace of one’s own body.

If one cannot achieve liberation and remains attached, the hun-soul will scatter and the spirit become disordered. Should even a single thought arise in this state, one will fall into the deluded ford. Those who aspire to higher learning must, at this moment, remain unmoved by all circumstances. Only generate the supreme mind; only cultivate boundless merit. Only generate the supreme mind; only cultivate boundless wisdom. Only generate the supreme mind; only cultivate boundless goodness. Only generate the mind of unobstructed freedom, desiring to widely reach the ten directions, so that all beings of the immeasurable and boundless future may hear the true Dao. Do not arise any greedy thoughts, any perverse views, any delusive dreams, any obstacles, any afflictions, or any defiled attachments to desire.

Such is the true Dharma—vast beyond conception, beyond description. Only then will one know that the orthodox tradition emerges from the profound and obscure, not seeking petty confirmations that delude the true nature.

And the gatha says:
All returns to reliance—
It is but a single condition.
If there is one whose virtue and conduct are complete,
Who abandons the mind of action and generates the intent of non-action,
Who does not distance themselves from revered virtue,
Nor draw near to the unkind,
Who contemplates the Three Treasures without ceasing,
Never wavering in resolve,
All practices perfected,
Virtue fully attained,
The Dao accomplished without defilement or hindrance—
You should know this scripture thus.

**Talismans of the Collected Spirits Scripture**
*Taiqing Realm Collected Spirits Scripture* concludes here.

**Taiqing Realm Central Essence Scripture** (Chapter Eight)

At that time, wishing to illuminate the true Dao, I emitted a five-colored radiant light, pervading the three thousand great thousand worlds. Within it, all manner of different worlds, heavens and hells, were fully revealed. The Heavenly Worthies of the Ten Directions and all the Great Perfected Immortals were also seen within it. The sufferings and joys of birth and death, the measure of karmic retribution, the stages of Daoist cultivation—all were seen within it. The lands of suffering and bliss were likewise revealed.

The assembly from the ten directions, as numerous as motes of dust and beyond counting, all beheld this radiant light. The boundless, immeasurable sufferings of hell-beings were also seen within this light. Then, the True Person of the Great Ultimate, through the power of great compassion, great mercy, and great wisdom, took pity on sentient beings, seeing their differing experiences of suffering and joy, the varying karmic retributions of heavens and hells. He only wished that the Heavenly Worthy, the Utmost Sage, would proclaim the teaching for the sake of all, delivering great benefit, enabling liberation, forever severing evil conditions, and swiftly rebirth in the Pure Land.

The Heavenly Worthy addressed the Heavenly Worthies of the Ten Directions, saying: "Now, by means of my qi, transform your bodies and descend to the Eastern Direction. If the people of a kalpa see the world’s suffering, then say: *The Heavenly Worthy of Jade Purity, who Bestows Blessings, delivers all from calamity.* For the wandering souls of the departed who have not yet transcended rebirth, say: *The Heavenly Worthy of the Jade Treasure, Supreme August One, delivers all from stagnation.* In the Southern Direction, the Heavenly Worthy who Prolongs Life and Augments Destiny saves the living; the Heavenly Worthy of Mysterious Perfection and Myriad Blessings delivers the dead. In the Western Direction, the Heavenly Worthy of the Eight Trigrams who Protects the Body saves the living; the Heavenly Worthy of Supreme Mystery delivers the dead..."

From this day forth, all shall see, all shall hear.
When you take refuge in the Dao and practice this,
Praise its merit, enter the ocean of merit.
In non-action, meet the Dao;

Boundless causes and conditions,

**Talismans of the True One Scripture**
*Taiqing Realm True One Scripture* concludes here.

chunks.original_text: 北方消灾解厄天尊济生，玄上玉晨天尊度死； 东北方紫清赐福天尊济生，度仙上圣天尊度死； 东南方长生保命天尊济生，好生度命天尊度死； 西南方福生无量天尊济生，太灵虚皇天尊度死； 西北方九宫捍厄天尊济生，无量太华天尊度死； 上方保命护身天尊济生，玉虚明皇天尊度死； 下方兴大福力天尊济生，真皇洞神天尊度死。 夫人之生皆是天气。 正北位居中一炁生水，万物皆因水而生。 故北斗居中天而旋回四方，主一切人民生死祸福。 北斗第一贪狼星、第三禄存星为东斗，主算； 北斗第二巨门星、第四文曲星为西斗，记名； 第六武曲星，正居本位为北斗，落死； 第五廉贞星为南斗，上生； 第七破军星正居中位为中斗大魁，总监众灵。 凡一切万物生死皆属北斗。 洞明星外辅周回，隐元星内弼，指十二辰。 济生则总曰旋玑玉衡，度死则总曰豁落。 若有众生遇其灾厄，随方禳谢，祈祷醮礼，善无不应。 而说偈曰： 以此要法，流通世间。 若有见闻，无量因缘。 善男信女，依事修行。 行平等行，心念欢喜。 有行之者，亦皆成就，正入无为，不退因缘。 一切众生，当信是言，受此正教，精勤奉行。 中精经灵符 太清境中精经　终

In the Northern Direction, the Heavenly Worthy who Dispels Disasters and Resolves Misfortunes saves the living; the Heavenly Worthy of Mysterious Supreme Jade Dawn delivers the dead. In the Northeastern Direction, the Heavenly Worthy of Purple Purity who Bestows Blessings saves the living; the Heavenly Worthy who Delivers Immortals and Supreme Sages delivers the dead. In the Southeastern Direction, the Heavenly Worthy of Longevity who Protects Life saves the living; the Heavenly Worthy of Compassionate Deliverance delivers the dead. In the Southwestern Direction, the Heavenly Worthy of Boundless Blessings saves the living; the Heavenly Worthy of Supreme Numinous Emptiness delivers the dead. In the Northwestern Direction, the Heavenly Worthy of the Nine Palaces who Shields from Misfortune saves the living; the Heavenly Worthy of Infinite Great Splendor delivers the dead. In the Upper Direction, the Heavenly Worthy who Protects Life and Guards the Body saves the living; the Heavenly Worthy of Jade Emptiness and Luminous Sovereignty delivers the dead. In the Lower Direction, the Heavenly Worthy who Augments Great Blessings saves the living; the Heavenly Worthy of the Grotto Spirits and True Sovereign delivers the dead.

The life of all people is born of the qi of Heaven. In the true north, the Central One qi generates water, and all things are born through water. Thus, the Northern Dipper resides at the center of Heaven, revolving through the Four Directions, governing the life, death, fortune, and misfortune of all people. The first star of the Northern Dipper, Greedy Wolf, and the third star, Wealth Repository, form the Eastern Dipper, which governs destiny. The second star, Great Gate, and the fourth star, Literary Brilliance, form the Western Dipper, which records names. The sixth star, Military Brilliance, rightfully occupies its position as the Northern Dipper, presiding over death. The fifth star, Integrity and Chastity, forms the Southern Dipper, which bestows life. The seventh star, Breaking Army, rightfully occupies the central position as the Great Chief of the Central Dipper, overseeing all spirits. All things in the myriad realms, in life and death, belong to the Northern Dipper. The External Assistant stars encircle it, the Hidden Origin stars inwardly assist it, and they point to the twelve earthly branches. When saving the living, they are collectively called the Jade Armillary Sphere; when delivering the dead, they are collectively called the Vast and Open. If sentient beings encounter disasters or misfortunes, they may perform expiatory rites, offer prayers, and hold jiao rituals according to the direction, and no good deed will go unanswered.

Then a gatha is spoken:
By this essential Dharma,
disseminated throughout the world,
if there are those who see or hear,
boundless karmic conditions arise.
Good men and faithful women,
practice in accordance with these affairs.
Cultivate the practice of equality,
with minds filled with joy.
Those who practice thus,
will all attain accomplishment,
rightly entering the non-action,
and the unretreatable karmic conditions.
All sentient beings,
should believe these words,
receive this true teaching,
and diligently uphold it.

The *Essential Scripture of the Grotto Spirits from the Taiqing Realm* concludes here.
